data.title: Woodrow Wilson Birthplace, Historic Site in Staunton, VA
data.meta_description: The Woodrow Wilson Birthplace in Staunton, Virginia is a historic venue that offers visitors a guided tour of the house where Woodrow Wilson was born and a self-guided tour of the museum. The museum features exhibits on Wilson's life and presidency, including topics such as women's suffrage, domestic reform, segregation, and World War I. Highlights include a restored 1919 Pierce-Arrow limousine and a state-of-the-art World War I trench exhibit. General admission tickets range from $12 to $20, and group tours and private behind-the-scenes tours are available by reservation. The venue also offers virtual programs, exhibits, and tours. Younger guests can enjoy a scavenger hunt, and the Archives & Research Center is available for research purposes by appointment.
